description.narrative: Det övergripande målet med insatsen är att stärka demokratin, genom att: 1. Kvinnor deltar och påverkar i beslutsfattandet 2. Ungdomar är representerade för att påverka beslutsfattandet 3. Civila samhällets organisationer har stärkts och påverkar effektivt beslut, främjar mänskliga rättigheter och stärker sina medlemmar.

Insatsen avser stöd till NPA (Norwegian People's Aid) som skall stödja ett antal civilsamhällesorganisationer i Irak för att öka deras förmåga att mobilisera människor och ge dem möjlighet att delta i samhällsutvecklingen. Syftet med stödet är att stärka organisationerna att föra kvinnors och ungdomars talan, och hålla regeringens institutioner ansvariga för bristande utveckling. NPA ser insatsen som en sätt att öka det demokratiska utrymmet i Irak, vilket man hävdar är krympande. De tre målen för insatsen avser ökat deltagande av kvinnor och ungdomar i det offentliga beslutsfattandet och öka civila samhällets påverkan på politiska beslut.

Support to NPA (Norwegian People's Aid), which in their turn will support a number of civil society organizations in Iraq to increase their ability to mobilize people and give them the opportunity to participate in social development. The purpose of the support is to strengthen the organizations to make women and young people to take part in the development of the society, and to hold the government's institutions responsible for lack of development. The NPA sees this as a way to increase democratic space in Iraq, which is shrinking. The three contribution objectives are aimed at increasing the participation of women and young people in public decision-making and to increase the impact of civil society on political decisions.

tag.narrative: 16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
The second phase of the project (2020) saw the emergence and rapid spread of COVID-19 pandemic in Iraq, resulting in the death of over 12 000 Iraquis by the end of the year, and the imposition of lockdowns and curfew. NPA´s staff and partners started working remotely in March. This continued until August, which saw a gradual return to office.
Some of NPA's partners - Emma organization for Human Development (Emma), Peace and Freedom Organization (PFO), al-Firdaws and al Tahir Association for Development (TAD), however, continued work during the lockdown, supporting government efforts to curb the spreadof the virus by a) conducting sanitisation operations in areas with the highest incidence of COVID 19, notably Baghdad, Najaf, Karbala and Basra (PFO), b) providing public awareness-raising campaigns in person as well as virtually and c) the distribution of hygiene kits (PFO, Emma, TAD and al-Firdaws).
Furthermore, movement restrictions aimed at curbing the spread of the virus, led to rise in frequency and severity of violence in the home (GBV), affecting many women and girls. Emma worked hard and supported the official operation of helplines and assisted women and girls exposed to the risk of domestic abuse to places of safety.
2020 also witnessed an intensification of political repression and human rights violations affecting directly NPA and their partners. NPA´s partner al-Firdaws is Basra received daily death threats forcing them to live in hiding for a period. In august 2020 one of their volunteers, was assainated by unknown gunmen.
Despite all challenges there have been important strides in the project.
PDO launched the academic center for women´s politial leadership and the first cohort graduated by the end of 2020.
Al Firdaws sucessfully concluded an evidence-based research on the role and status of women in Iraqui institutions (non military) in Basra.
Emma contributed to the creation of a Kurdistan Women´s Lobby.
Following the announcement of parliamentary election in 2021, PFO reactivated the previous set up alternative network al Raqueeb to observe elections and hold trainings in all 18 Iraqui provinces for teams of observers and media.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
